title: Lowest Human Capital Index
description: In 2020, the Central African Republic had a Human Capital Index of 0.29, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Internet Usage
description: As of 2019, only 7.51% of the population in the Central African Republic used the internet, indicating very low connectivity.

title: Highest Adolescent Fertility Rate
description: In 2023, the adolescent fertility rate in the Central African Republic was 163.1 births per 1,000 women aged 15-19, one of the highest in the world.

title: Highest Self-Employment Rate
description: In 2023, 94.54% of the total employment in the Central African Republic was self-employed, indicating a high level of informal employment.

title: Lowest Access to Safe Drinking Water
description: In 2022, only 6.13% of the population in the Central African Republic had access to safely managed drinking water services.

title: Highest Vulnerable Employment Rate
description: In 2023, 93.32% of the total employment in the Central African Republic was considered vulnerable, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Lowest Literacy Rate for Young Females
description: In 2020, the literacy rate for females aged 15-24 in the Central African Republic was only 29.11%.

title: Highest Age Dependency Ratio
description: In 2023, the age dependency ratio in the Central African Republic was 105.18%, indicating a high proportion of dependents to working-age population.
